text: I love how you brought up the idea of cultural currency, Chip. It's like artists are not only creating music, but also archiving and reinterpreting the past for a new audience. This curatorial approach can be incredibly powerful in creating a sense of shared experience and community. I think it's also worth exploring how social media and streaming platforms have changed the way we consume and interact with music. With playlists and algorithms, songs can now reach a massive audience in a matter of hours. How do you think this shift has impacted the way artists approach songwriting and production, especially when it comes to creating viral hits?
